Deficiency Narrative: During a heightened monitoring visit to the operation on 08/14/2025, some donuts, with a best if used by date of 08/04/25, located on the counter in the kitchen were observed to have mold on them.
Correction Narrative: On 8/26/25 and 9/8/2025 physical site inspections occurred. During each inspection the refrigerator, freezer and pantry were checked for expired and or spoiled food. Bread on both cottages were also inspected for mold, and none was observed. The written corrections were received during the inspection on 9/8/2025. Staff have been provided a checklist in which food needs to be inspected and or discarded. The package of donuts with a mold spot were discarded.  Administrative staff will conduct a week day walk through including inspection of food items.  Executive Director will conduct at least a twice monthly walk through including inspection of food items.

Deficiency Narrative: Roughhousing between two residents escalated. One resident placed the other in a headlock and transitioned to placing hands around the neck and choking. The caregiver delayed to de-escalate and intervene.
Correction Narrative: On 9/19/2025 the operation provided a corrective action letter. Training was conducted on 9/16/25 and individually on 9/17/2025 for the caregiver who was unable to attend on 9/16/2025. Training included supervision, early intervention, follow-up after any physical altercations including examination of youth, documentation and reporting to on-call. Rules, expectations, and consistency among staff and with all youth were discussed. A record of caregiver signatures who attended the class was provided. On 9/23/2025 the staff training folder was reviewed. Certificates of training were located in the binder for all caregivers required to attend the training.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the facility vans had a protruding wire sticking out of the second seat and a sliding door that came off the hinges when the door was opened.  This was corrected at the initial inspection, but residents were transported in this vehicle for several weeks before the issues were fixed.
The residents and staff witnessed a caregiver threatening placements and inappropriate discipline at the operation.
Correction Narrative: Program Director who was in training at the time, introduced additional structure and expectations to be implemented in the future. Staff completed initial training and orientation. Staff was retrained in Minimum Standards related to discipline.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee at the operation was using profanity towards the residents and in the presence of direct care staff.
Correction Narrative: Program Director who was in training at the time, introduced additional structure and expectations to be implemented in the future. Staff completed initial training and orientation including the verbal de-escalation segments of PAPH.  Staff was retrained in Minimum Standards related to discipline.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walk-through of the operation, it was observed that conditions of a cabin were not clean. The boy's rooms were observed to be cluttered, the bathroom toilet dispenser was broken off, dirty dishes were observed in the kitchen sink and a liquid was observed on one of the bedroom floors.
Correction Narrative: On 6/3/2025 a physical site inspection was conducted at both cottages for corrections. All bathrooms had functioning toilet paper dispensers. No dirty dishes were observed in the sinks. There was no liquid on the floors.  Resident's rooms were organized and met requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care reported seeing a caregiver sleeping while on night duty. The child called out to the caregiver while getting a drink of water and initially received no response until being woken. One caregiver reported observing the same caregiver sleeping on duty when coming on shift. This occurred on two separate occasions. One caregiver also reported observing a separate caregiver sleeping in the office.
Correction Narrative: Management at the operation met with all caregivers and discussed the requirements of 24/7 awake supervision at the operation. Caregivers were required to sign off stating they understood the requirement. Additionally, the operation will be conducting un-announced night inspections at the cottages twice a month. The operation created a form for management to fill out when conducting the visit.

Deficiency Narrative: A preliminary service plan was not provided for the victim child in this case.
Correction Narrative: Chester Amidon provided a correction stating they have retrained the new case manager on the 72-hour time frame for the preliminary plan, which will be monitored by the case manager supervisor for timely completion.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed one child's medication log contained an entry for which no time of administration was recorded.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating an HM task is being implemented to address documentation errors which will include a weekly review by the PQI Coordinator or Assistant, who will then report to the administrator, and a plan will be developed to address any errors which arise.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed six child service plans lacked specific goals in multiple areas.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating the new case manager has received additional instruction regarding expectations regarding the completion of service plans with thorough inclusion of goals, needs, and strategies.   The administrator will ensure the initial plan is completed in a timely manner and reflected in ChildTrax documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed the service plans for three children did not include available CAN's results and accurate recommendations.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating the new case manager has received additional instruction regarding expectations regarding the completion of service plans with thorough inclusion of CAN's results and recommendations.   The administrator will ensure the initial plan is completed in a timely manner and reflected in ChildTrax documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed a child's service plan failed to record when the plan was provided to the child's parent entity.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating the new case manager has received additional instruction regarding expectations regarding expectations they upload the email documenting the provision of the service plan to the parent entity into their system in a timely manner.  The administrator will ensure this email is uploaded into ChildTrax.  This brings this standard back into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed a child's service plan lacking the results of the most recent Psychological Evaluation or attempts to schedule a new one.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating the new case manager has received additional instruction regarding expectations regarding the completion of service plans with thorough inclusion of goals, needs, strategies, and psychological evaluation results.   The administrator will ensure the initial plan is completed in a timely manner and reflected in ChildTrax documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed the medication logs for one child's medication failed to document an administration of this medication on 12/21/24.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating an HM task is being implemented to address missed medication through a weekly review by the PQI Coordinator or Assistant, reporting to the administrator, and developing a plan to address each error as it is identified.  This brings this standard back into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed the service plan for one child did not include his signature or documentation of refusal.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating the case manager has received additional instruction regarding expectations they acquire a child's signature or a notation of refusal to sign for each child's service plan henceforth.  This will be monitored by the administrator through ensuring the signed service plan is uploaded into ChildTrax.  This brings this standard back into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I observed two staff failed to take Trauma Informed Care training in 2024.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25, the operation provided a written plan stating training is being tracked through a new system which will email the worker and supervisor multiple advanced notices of training which is coming due or is past due.  The supervisor will monitor these notices and ensure all annual trainings are completed as required prior to scheduling that staff to work.  This brings this standard back into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's medication log did not include the reason the medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: Corrections made and shared with RCCR on medication form for child.

Deficiency Narrative: The medication count for one of the residents did  not match the medication documentation log
Correction Narrative: Two staff will be retrained in dispensation of PRN medications.  Training will include need to record administration of PRN medications given at times other than the medication time of other routine medications.  Medication dispensation of PRN medications will be recorded at the time the PRN medication is taken.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through of the operation it was found that there were no towels at the sinks in the one of  the  bathrooms.

During the inspection, I observed the operation last administered a prescription nasal spray on 9/27/24 prior to the child's visit.  The medication was not administered again following that date as it did not return to the operation from the visit.  As of the date of the inspection, the operation was not in posession of this prescription medication and the child has not received an administration since 9/27/24
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up, I reviewed records for all three children with medications and observed no issues.  All records and counts were in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a medication log for a child included documentation of one medication administration on 9/30/24  that staff confirmed did not occur as the medication did not return with the child from his last visit and the operation was not in posession of the medication at the time of this inspection.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up, I reviewed records for all three children with medications and observed no issues.  All records and counts were in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was seriously injured on 9/22/24, and the parent was not notified until 9/23/24, a day after the child was verified safe.
Correction Narrative: On 1/14/25, the operation submitted a written correction plan stating the administrator would take responsibility for ensuring the parent entity is notified in a timely manner.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, the operation did not provide documents, when requested. Copies of the admissions assessments were provided after the conclusion of the inspection, but discharge summaries were never produced.
Correction Narrative: On 9/23/2024, the administrator advised the operation's plan of correction for deficiency 748.399(a). The administrator will ensure that records are available through Childtrax or subsequent information management system or in the form of hard copies.  Records will be completed in a timely manner and uploaded or available as reproductions.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, the operation was not able to provide all documents when requested such as discharge summaries for two children.
Correction Narrative: On 9/23/2024, the administrator advised the operation's plan of correction for deficiency 748.1437(1). The administrator will ensure that discharge summaries or documentation include date and circumstances of discharge.  The summary or documentation will be completed in a timely manner and will be uploaded into Childtrax or subsequent information management system to be readily available for monitoring.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walk through of the operation one bathroom was found not to have hand towels at the sink. Staff corrected this issue at the time of the inspection.

The investigation revealed that the operation did not inform the permanency specialist/conservator of a child in care's fractured hand. The permanency specialist/conservator remained unaware until the inspector brought it to her attention.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email stating the following:Serious injury/illness will continue to be reported to the managing conservator, DFPS, via the DFPS hotline.  In addition, children placed through SSCCs will be contacted through incident report in the Texas Provider Network or method prescribed by the contract with that particular SSCC or by phoning/emailing the care coordinator or similarly titled staff.

Deficiency Narrative: The investigation revealed that a child in care suffered an injury which was not promptly addressed. The child, having injured his hand, was seen by a doctor who recommended an X-ray. However, the X-ray was not performed until two weeks following this recommendation.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email stating the following:Proper medical care will be provided as indicated.  For injury/illness requiring immediate care, treatment will be sought through Urgent Care or Emergency Room.  For non-critical injuries or delayed symptoms, recommendation of primary care physician will be followed.  If non-immediate x-rays are ordered by the primary care physician rather than urgent care or emergency room, they will be acquired as scheduled.  If schedule modifications are required, the primary care physician will be consulted, or they will be taken to urgent care or emergency room prior to the scheduled x-ray.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, there was rotten fruit observed in the refrigerator.
During the monitoring inspection, there was one medication record that did not have documentation of the medication (Escitalopram 10mg) administered to the child on the evening of 4/27/2024.
Correction Narrative: The administrator provided plan of corrections which stated staff member received medication administration retraining.  Log was corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: During the ANE Investigation, it was reported the operation staff permitted a child to go into the staff office, close, and lock the door, behind him. At that time, the child had access to child records that are stored in the staff office.
Correction Narrative: The administrator provided plan of corrections which stated the childrens active records are stored electronically or locked in the administrative office.  Supplemental records such as CSAs and Medicaid cards will be locked in the cottage office. The cottage office will remain locked when not occupied by a staff member.  Youth will not be permitted in the office unaccompanied by staff.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was found that the staff member on duty did not intervene when two children began physically fighting. This resulted in a child in care having to intervene in order to stop the altercation. The staff member lacked prudent judgement in not trying to stop the altercation between the two children.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email that that the staff members had been retrained.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was learned that no one was monitoring the child while he was being restrained.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email that staff members have been retrained as recently as the end of March. 2024

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was learned that a post discussion with the child was not held after he was restrained.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email that staff members have been retrained as recently as the end of March. 2024

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was learned that the caregiver for the children did not try to intervene in anyway when the altercation started including the verbal altercation.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email that staff members have been retrained as recently as the end of March. 2024

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was found that a child in care restrained another child in care. The child in care who conducted the restraint does not have the necessary training in restraints.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email that staff members have been retrained as recently as the end of March. 2024

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to comply with the safety plan implemented during the ANE investigation.
Correction Narrative: On 4/2/2024, the Administrator provided corrections via email. The Administrator advised, in the future, safety plans will be provided to the care workers in the cottage. The safety plan related to this investigation is no longer in effect as it was time limited until the original investigation was closed. The youth requiring the additional supervision is currently in the psychiatric hospital, and a 14 day notice had been submitted prior to the hospitalization.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, a package of spinash that was found rotten, expired, and almost liquified in the refrigerator.
During the monitoring inspection, a window located next to the front door was observed to have a crack. There was also a toilet in the home that was observed to be dirty and needing to be cleaned.
Correction Narrative: On 1/30/2024, the Administrator, Chester Amidon, advised the small Plexiglas window at entry with a crack in it was replaced. Picture was attached.  The commode in the bathroom, out of use for repair and with the tank lid off, had a gasket replaced to allow for better volume for refuse removal and cleaned. Picture was attached.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, the first aid kit was missing tweezers.
Correction Narrative: On 1/30/2024, the Administrator, Chester Amidon, advised a new first aid kit supplied with the required items was purchased and placed in the cottage. A picture was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, one child's medication records was missing the reason medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: On 1/30/2024, the Administrator, Chester Amidon, advised medication log from placement the afternoon before lacked reason and was awaiting information from worker. Director of Residential Services was retrained in intake procedures and log completion to include reason.  He was instructed that if the worker is unable to provide reason when interviewed at placement, that intake staff are responsible for researching reason.  Certificate was attached.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, a bottle of Pine-Sol was observed to be in the common area and accessible to a child in care.

During the investigation inspection, two of the three bathrooms had empty paper towel dispensers and no personal towels or hand dryers for use. This was previously citated at the last inspection completed earlier this month.
Correction Narrative: Administrator put paper towels and all of the bathrooms. They will do checks daily to ensure there are paper towels at all sinks.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, there was a bowl of food (corn) uncovered and stored in the refrigerator.
Correction Narrative: Administrator removed the food that was uncovered and threw it away. They will ensure that all food is covered.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, medication records were reviewed, and it was observed that one child's medication record was inaccurate. The record indicated the medication had 26 doses remaining, while the package only contained 25 doses. It was also observed that the balance on the medication record was wrong and there was not a deduction after each dose provided. This was previously cited at the monitoring inspection completed in May of this year.
Correction Narrative: Administrator sent email with the med log corrected and the additional training.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through of the inspection, it is noticed that the pantry door had a hole and the ledge of it was coming off.
Correction Narrative: The administrator provided photograph to verify the door was replaced and repaired.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through of the operation, it is noticed that 2 of the restrooms did not have toilet paper in the bathrooms. This was corrected during the inspection by rolls of toilet paper being added to those bathrooms.

Upon reviewing fire inspections, it is noticed that their most recent fire drill was done outside of the 6 months on 4/2/2023. This was corrected at the inspection by the operation conducting a fire drill.

Upon reviewing documents, it is noticed that the operation did not have documentation or had conducted a severe weather drill. This was also corrected at the inspection by having a severe weather drill conducted by the operation.

During the walk through of the operation, it is noticed that 2 of the boys bedrooms did not have pillow cases on the pillow. This was corrected at the inspection by one pillow being removed from the room and a pillow case being added to the other pillow.
The kids' bathroom on the right side of the facility had mold in the shower floor and doors.  There were soiled walls and baseboards around the large  trash can, and the vents were covered with dust.
Correction Narrative: Photos sent of cleaned bathroom areas.

Deficiency Narrative: There were 4 tomatoes with mold in the refrigerator and several packets of snack sandwiches covered in mold.  Also, a large bag of shredded cheese was completely opened in the same drawer.
Correction Narrative: Pictures of the refrigerator cleaned out - no more rotten produce or packages of snack cakes that are not fresh.

Deficiency Narrative: Four beds in use had no mattress protectors.
Correction Narrative: Photos sent of the mattresses that were missing protectors.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the children's beds (in use) had no pillowcases.
Correction Narrative: Pillow pictures taken and sent to my by Chester Amidon.

Deficiency Narrative: There was nothing written on a child's medication record for "reason the medication was prescribed".
Correction Narrative: Corrected forms were sent and added to the document library.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver argued with children in care, and then she commented "at least I have a home to go home to" - which was demeaning to the boys in the facility.
Correction Narrative: Mr. Amidon met with Dominique Ellis to review child right issues and reiterate the trainings that Ms. Ellis has completed.  This review/extra training was put in her employee file. Please see document library.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a hole in the surround of a shower stall, and the operation did not show a maintenance request on file for the damage.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a picture via email as documentation of the hole being repaired.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the unannounced after hours inspection, it was observed that a child's medication record and actual medication count did not match. The medication record reflected there were 24 doses remaining while the package only contained 23 doses.
Correction Narrative: On 5/30/2023, the Administrator advised that during a staff meeting on 5/24, the PQI Director covered the need to record PRN medications as well as routine medications accurately. Content included the need to verify the count with actual number rather than just subtracting one from prior count.  Content also includes the need to replace a medication rather than discarding if not given.  For example, if a medication is pulled thinking it was a routine medication when it was actually changed to PRN such as this particular medication.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a sink a cottage bathroom with a broken hot water knob preventing its use.  The operation repaired the knob while I was there for the inspection.

During the inspection, I observed the curtains in one bedroom to be suspended in such a way that the curtains did not adequately cover the window to provide requisite privacy or sufficiently block light for rest.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the curtains in one bedroom to be suspended in such a way that the curtains did not adequately cover the window to provide requisite privacy or sufficiently block light for rest.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of this investigation, evidence indicates that a staff failed to properly supervise children in care, resulting in a resident having inappropriate contact with a minor online and several residents being able to congregate, contact this same minor, and call the police without the staff's awareness.
Correction Narrative: During the course of this investigation, evidence indicates that a staff failed to properly supervise children in care, resulting in a resident having inappropriate contact with a minor online and several residents being able to congregate, contact this same minor, and call the police without the staff's awareness.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the documentation, I observed that the resident's service plan did discuss or assess documented behaviors that resulted in increased supervision levels as documented in the operation's corrective actions to a previous investigation.
Correction Narrative:
On 5/23/23, the operation offered this correction plan via email:

Administrator will insure that service plan reviews include needs, strategies, and instructions including any safety plans or supervision plan changes since the last review.  The administrator or designee will review and sign service plan for appropriate inclusion of behavioral information since last review.  

This will bring this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed no thermometer in the refrigerator.  The operation replaced the thermometer during the inspection.
The operation is equipped with an electric smoke detection system, and the operation was not able to produce documentation of annual testing of the system by an approved party.
Correction Narrative: On 1/13/23, the administrator provided a copy of the fire inspection form denoting the system had been tested and passed via email.  The administrator also included a picture of the new smoke detectors for the system which include a testing button on each detector.  This brings the facility into compliance with this standard.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed pillow cases and sheets missing from a number of the children's beds.
Correction Narrative: All beds with residents assigned were fitted with appropriate sheets and pillowcases.

Deficiency Narrative: There were over 5 places found where a staff failed to sign when medicatoins were given.  The timeframe ranged from late 2021 to May of 2022.
Correction Narrative: Pages were reviewed with direct care staff by the administrator.  Staff will be signing a new sheet at the end of each shift to ensure that initials are used for each medication administration.

Deficiency Narrative: The facility did not have any record of severe weather drills.
Correction Narrative: Documentation of the first severe weather drill was sent in, as well as plans to do them no less than every 6 months.

Deficiency Narrative: There were several medication sheets for two boys that did not state the reason the medications were prescribed.
Correction Narrative: Paperwork was sent by Chester Amidon showing that these issues were reviewed with all staff and stating the importance of all sections on the medication logs.  They will be using more tools to document the issues that require explanations and signatures.

Deficiency Narrative: In three of the four records reviewed, there was either no date for a copy of the service plan being provided to the children, no child's signature, or no documentation that a copy was provided to the child.
Correction Narrative: Chester reviewed the standard with staff and retrained the case management staff to ensure that this doesn't happen again.  See digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: A young man with a history of sexual abuse and a pre-occupation with pornography did not receive adequate supervision.  This resulted in sexually inappropriate behaviors and solicitation of younger kids.
Correction Narrative: Correction was sent-- All staff meeting on 10/20/22 where staff were reminded and retrained regarding individual needs and supervision requirements.  The child who was misusing his phone and the internet is being watched closely and his supervision has increased.

Deficiency Narrative: The one first aid kit at the operation was missing a thermometer - as required by minimum standards.
Correction Narrative: Chester Amidon sent me pictures of their  new first aid kids and the thermometers that have been added at the facility.

Deficiency Narrative: There was one first aid kit in the house, but none in the vehicles to transport the boys.  There should always be one available for the vehicle that is taking the kids on an outing.  There should be a minimum of two at the Valley View Cottage.
Correction Narrative: The administrator sent pictures of the various first aid kits that are now in the vehicles and the cottage.

Deficiency Narrative: Two beds did not have protective convers separating the mattress and the sheet.  There was also one pillow case missing.
Correction Narrative: The pictures were sent to me of the pillow with a new pillow case on it.  Entered into digital storage.  Also the mattress protectors.

Deficiency Narrative: In one of the child's records reviewed, the name used in the service plan is not  the child  who the  plan is  being completed for.
Correction Narrative: I received a training certificate for the case manager who was re-trained on Service Plans.  The training took place on 6/15/21/ and 6/16/21. This information was sent via email from Chester Amidon.

Deficiency Narrative: In the child's records reviewed, an evaluation of the strategies and techniques used were not included in the Service Plan Review. The information documented in the service plans reviewed is cut and pasted from the previous service plan, with no changes.
Correction Narrative: I received a training certificate for the case manager who was re-trained on Service Plans.  The training took place on 6/15/21/ and 6/16/21. This information was sent via email from Chester Amidon.

Deficiency Narrative: There was a report of a staff testing positive for COVID.  This was reported to the hotline, but there was no documentation available for review during this inspection.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action for the citation issued above was submitted by Chester Amidon, Administrator.  In the future, serious incidents will continue to be documented in the childs electronic file on Childtrax when the incident involves a child.  If the incident is not an incident related to a child such as this one related to a staff with Covid 19, it will be recorded on an incident report form.  Attached is a completed incident report form for the noted incident.

Deficiency Narrative: The service plan reviewed is not signed by the child or agency supervisor.
Correction Narrative:
I received a plan of correction from Chester Amidon.  It states the following:
Case Manager will submit service plan reviews to agency supervisor for review and signature.  Casemanager will assure that service plan reviews are signed by care worker, residential coordinator, professional level service provider and youth prior to uploading the document in Childtrax.  Casemanager will review all current plans of service and acquire any needed signatures.

Deficiency Narrative: In one of the Admission Assessments reviewed it was not signed or dated by professional level service provider who completed the assessment.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action was received from Chester Amidon, Administrator, for the citation issued above.  Moving forward the operation will ensure Admission Assessments will be signed and dated by a professional level service provider meeting the qualifications in 748.563.

Deficiency Narrative: In one of the staff records reviewed the staff completed 32 annual training hours for 2020.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action was received from Chester Amidon, Administrator, for the citation issued above.  Moving forward the operation will ensure that caregivers will receive the required annual training that will be placed in their Bamboo HR personnel file.  If the operation has 25 or more children in care that are receiving treatment services or 30% or more of the total population of children in care are receiving treatment services the annual training will total at least 50 hours.

Deficiency Narrative: Most of the children's beds had one or two pillows with no pillow cases.
Correction Narrative: Pictures were sent to me showing all the beds with clean pillow cases.

Deficiency Narrative: Some of the staff have threatened the boys' placements as a form of discipline.  This was stated by 4 of the 5 boys interviewed.
Correction Narrative: Staff are being retrained on inappropriate discipline - threatening placements.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the boys' showers was very dirty, with mold and mildew along the bottom rail and entrance to the shower.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent showing the shower had been thoroughly cleaned

Deficiency Narrative: All of the mattresses either had no cover,  or the cover was not waterproof.
Correction Narrative: Pictures sent to me showing mattress covers on all the beds.

Deficiency Narrative: In the child's  records reviewed two prescription medication was not give at prescribed.
Correction Narrative: A inspection was made to the operation.  I reviewed staff training record for the three staff.  The three staff were re-trained on medication on 11/5/20.  I observed the training certificate for each staff.

Deficiency Narrative: In one of the bedroom a piece of wood was shaped in the form of a sword with sharp metal object placed in one end.  Several fish hooks were also observed in this bedroom and in reach of children.
Correction Narrative: A inspection was made on 11/5/20.  A complete walk any object of the cottage was done.  The cottage was observed and found to be free of sharp objects.  The fishing hooks and poles are stored in the back room.  The kitchen was observed and found to be clean and orderly.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was subjected to profane language.
Correction Narrative: As part of the safety plan during the investigation, all care workers were retrained in the Azleway discipline policy including refraint from the use of profanity.
